intro: Thalictrum uchiyamae, commonly known as the Uchiyama meadow rue, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage and showy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and streamside areas. It has small, palmately divided leaves and produces numerous stamens that give it a fluffy appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
